subject: [WIP]Add config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval" for scheduler
commit_message:
[WIP]Add config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval" for scheduler

In nova-scheduler, we now use
scheduler/host_manager/update_from_compute_node()
to update information about a host from a ComputeNode
object. Currently, the information won't update
if the updated time in scheduler is later than
the updated_at time in compute:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/scheduler/host_manager.py#L162-L164

This is generally correct but as the periodic task
updates information in compute only update the information
when if there are changes:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L659

This may cause inconsistency if the scheduler have
consumed(updated) the information but then the compute
fail to claim (the periodic task won't update because
there are no changes).

This patch adds a config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval".
If the updated time in scheduler is later than
updated_at in compute but the difference bettween the
updated time in scheduler and current time is larger
than this interval, it will still update the information
from compute to avoid inconsistency. The default value
of this config option is set to be 300 seconds for reference.

Doc-impact:

Change-Id: I095c8eb01f6087a73b1dbf2f5500a2a8a674615e
Closes-bug: #1528743

Use filters to generate the list of filter weights. This uses an ordered
list of filters to create a bit field that gives you the list of host

This also uses the existing weighers system, normalises the output
between 0 and 1, then adds that to the score from the above system.

always win out any older weighers.

Introduces the new configuration scheduler_soft_filters that allows
users to set the list of filters that should be used for weights.

To simulate Neutron database operations in unit tests, FakeQuery and
FakeSession are defined to replace the original Query and Session
objects. After service subnets feature is merged into Neutron[1], during
ip allocation, Neutron calls Query.add_entity to query subnet by service
type. However, FakeQuery object doesn't have add_entity method, thus
unit tests fail to pass.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Mock _allocate_ips_for_port to bypass the service subnet query, which
is not necessary in the unit tests.

   to realize the solution
No new feature introduced.

provides one or more Virtual Functions (VFs) and a Physical
Function(PF).  These VF’s could be attached to VMs like a dedicated
PCIe device, which boosts the networking performance considerably.

subject: More sophisticated logging on privileged side
commit_message:
More sophisticated logging on privileged side

Any python logging messages generated on the privileged side (that
exceed the python logging level) are sent to the unprivileged side,
where the actual write to the regular oslo.log logger occurs.

Before, those priv->unpriv logging messages were dumb lines written to
stderr.  This meant the original severity level was lost, and the unpriv
side made the arbitrary/conservative choice to always log them at WARNING.

With this change, those priv->unpriv logging messages are sent down the
regular priv<->unpriv communication channel using a new "out of band"
mechanism.  The messages now include the original severity level, which
the unpriv side now honours.  And there was much rejoicing.

Any lines that *do* end up on stderr (using the exec method) will
continue to be logged at WARNING, since these will most likely be
"privsep-helper command not found" or similarly important.

Change-Id: Ifc63aedbec4ababefd2138cb73b348e2698db4ad
Closes-Bug: #1593743

subject: Updates and fixes to NIC config template routes
commit_message:
Updates and fixes to NIC config template routes

This change adds the ManagementInterfaceDefaultRoute parameter
for setting the Management network as the default route in some
deployments. Notes were added to indicate that if the Management
network is used as the default gateway, then the default route
on the control plane should be commented out.

The sample network-environment.yaml was modified to include the
ManagementInterfaceDefaultRoute, but this is commented out like
the rest of the Management network parameters.

This change also adds the ControlPlaneDefaultRoute and
ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute to all templates, so that if the
networks are customized, the NIC configs can be modified without
having to modify the parameters section of the template. The
default for the ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute is '10.0.0.1', and
the default for ManagementInterfaceDefaultRoute is set to 'unset'.

This change also converts the single-nic-linux-bridge-vlans from
DHCP to static IPs on the Control Plane Interface, bringing these
templates in line with the rest of the NIC config templates. The
parameters needed to be updated in these templates as well.

The controller-v6.yaml templates had a default value of "10.0.0.1"
for the ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute. This was confusing, and is
now undefined.

This change also sets a default gateway on the Control Plane in
controller-no-external.yaml templates.

Change-Id: I8ea6733fe46902e1baeff4ccfbcd42ecc5a1825f

commit_message:
Show items in-transition

Use the registry to detect items that are in a transition state
(like 'queued' images). Show a progress bar in the status column.

Also, for consistency, use that same progress bar in the actions
column for "dirty" items that the user has just acted upon.

Dirty items are polled individually at high frequency to give the
user a sense that their action has immediate effect.

In-transition items may appear as a result of this user's action,
or another user's action, so they are not individually polled.

A possible optimization is to individually poll in-transition items
that are a result of a user's action to dirty them...but this has
a variety of corner cases to consider and is not attempted as
part of this patch.

subject: Poll "dirty" items on paused searches
commit_message:
Poll "dirty" items on paused searches

When a user acts on an item, that item is considered "dirty" until we
get a newer version of that item from the searchlight index.

Normally, this happens very quickly, often by the next search poll
interval (default 10 seconds). However, when the overall search is paused,
dirty items will never be cleared.

This patch polls on *only* dirty items until those items are no longer
dirty. Items a user has directly acted on will now be "live" until they
are no longer dirty...even when the overall search is paused.

Finally, this persists the current query in the search settings. Search
settings are effectively tied to this single search table anyway. In
the future, perhaps a system will be created to allow multiple search
components to all have their own settings.

Partially-Implements: blueprint edit-live-data

subject: Fix remotable object change tracking
commit_message:
Fix remotable object change tracking

This is a fix/workaround for the fact that when remotable calls
are made on an object, and nova-conductor is using a newer version
of the object, then updates['obj_what_changed'] can contain fields
that don't exist in the lower-versioned object.

The problem arises from the fact that self.obj_what_changed() is
called against the newer object, and it can return fields that
don't exist in the lower-versioned object.  In particular, this
can happen in ConductorManager.object_action() in nova-conductor
as well as in the code modified in this commit.

The workaround is to double-check the changed fields from within
within the lower-versioned object, as well as to try to avoid
sending the invalid information when we can.

Also add some robustness around the obj_get_changes() code to
defend against this possible case if we deserialize a bogus
primitive.

A fix to a test for the stable fixture is also required because
that test was ... returning changes for fields it didn't have.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Icb48bb5d1b96069a45c1887d3f9da3d2eea38f4d
Closes-Bug: #1613488
